Name: Mummy-mask of painted and gilded cartonnage
Description: Painted and gilded mummy-mask of cartonnage, from the tomb of a rich woman in the Ptolemaic Period. The woman is depicted with intricate hairstyle and colourful floral collar. The rounded cheeks and wide eyes are typical of the idealising style in Egyptian formal art during this period. The outstanding quality of the piece and the use of gold indicate that the owner belonged to the elite, who continued to adhere to Pharaonic art and funerary practice until the Roman Period.
